section.title: Manage Portlets and Gadgets
section.para: Portlets and gadgets are organized in different categories. Each category contains one or several portlets or gadgets. You can also mix portlets and gadgets into one category. By default all gadgets are placed in the ExoGadgets category.

section.title: Add a new Category
section.para: You easily add a new category by following these guides:

step.para: Go to Administration -> Application Registry page -> Organize item.
Open a form to add a new category on the right pane by clicking the Add Category button on the action bar:
The Category Setting tab: includes common information about a category.

listitem.para: The name of the category which you want to add. This field is required and its length must be between 3 and 30 characters.
The display name of the category in list and its length must be between 3 and 30 characters.
A brief description of the category. Any length from 0 to 255 characters is allowed.

step.para: The Permission Setting tab: used to set the access permission for a category.

This access permission enters the game whenever a user creates or modifies a page. In that moment the user only can see and use portlets in those categories on which he or she has access permission (defined by groups and memberships).
Enter values for required fields in this form.
Click the Save button to accept adding a new category into a category list. The new category will be added into a list on the left pane.

section.title: Edit a Category
section.para: You can edit a category in list by following:

step.para: Click the edit icon!images/EditIcon1.png! on the title bar of a category that you want to edit.
Change the information of the selected category.
Click the Save button to accept changes.

section.title: Delete a Category
section.para: You also easily remove a category from a list:

step.para: Click the trash can icon!images/DeleteIcon.png! on the Title bar of the category that you want to delete.
Click on the OK button on the message to accept deleting or click on the Cancel button to quit.

section.title: Add Portlets/Gadgets to the specific Category
section.para: You can follow these steps to add a portlet/gadget to your prefered category :

step.para: Click the "add" icon!images/AddIcon.png! on the title bar of a category to which you want to add portlets. An interface will appear in the right pane as you can see below:

listitem.para: The display name of a portlet/gadget that you want to add to a category.

step.para: Enter the display name and select a type for the selected portlet/gadget.
Select a portlet/gadget by checking the radio button.
Click the Save button to accept adding a portlet/gadget to a category.

section.title: Set Access Permission on Portlets
section.para: You easily set an access permission on a portlet by following these guides:

step.para: Go to GateIn Start -> Page Navigations -> select Administration --> Application Registry

Select a category on the left pane that includes the portlet you want to set right. Then all portlets of the selected category are listed immediately and detail information of each portlet is displayed on the right pane.
To set permission for a portlet:

listitem.para: Click the Add Permission button to add access permissions to more groups.
Or check the Make it public check box to allow everyone to access.

step.para: Whenever the user creates or modifies a page he or she can only see and use portlets that fulfill two conditions: the portlet is in a category on which the user has access permission (see category section above) and the user has access permission on the portlet

section.title: View detail information of the specific Portlets
section.para: You easily view detail information of all specific portlets by following these guides:

step.para: On the navigation bar, go to the Administration-> Application Registry page-> Portlet item . A form to view all portlets will appear:

listitem.para: lists all portlets in two parts: Local and Remote
shows detail information about a portlet: Name, Display name, Description and Portlet preferences.

step.para: Select one portlet in the list on the left pane. The detail information of that portlet appears on the right pane.

section.title: Add a Gadget
section.para: You can follow these steps to add a gadget to the gadget list :
1. Go to the Administration --> Application Registry and click on Gadget :
There are two ways to add gadgets:

step.para: Open the form to add a remote gadget by clicking Add a remote gadget :
Enter a link to an .xml file in the URL field.
Click on the Add button to accept the entered URL or on the Cancel button to quit. The added gadget will be added into gadget list on left pane of the Dashboard portlet.
Show the form to add a new gadget by clicking Create a new gadget :

listitem.para: The source code to create a new gadget. This source will be a .xml file.

step.para: Enter a value for the Source field in this form.
Click the Save button to create a new gadget. The created gadget will be added to the gadget list on the left pane of the Dashboard Portlet.

section.para: You also edit, refresh and delete a local gadget as well as a remote gadget:

section.title: Add a new Gadget to the Dashboard Portlet
section.para: You can add a new gadget to the gadget list in the Dashboard portlet :

step.para: Go to the Dashboard on the navigation bar. Click on the Add Gadgets link :
The dialog to add a new gadget will appear :
Enter a link (a .xml file or RSS) in the text box on the left pane.
Click on the icon!images/PlusIcon.png! to add a new gadget to the gadget list beneath.
Click the edit icon!images/EditGadget.png! . It will display a dialog:
After editing , click the Save button to accept changing or Cancel button to quit.

formalpara.title: Local gadget
formalpara.para: After editing information about the gadget that you want to, click the icon!images/Refresh.png! to refresh all information of that gadget.

formalpara.title: Remote gadget
formalpara.para: When information of a remote gadget has been changed by another server, click the icon!images/Refresh.png! means it will update information of a remote gadget from that server.

step.para: Click the trash can icon!images/DeleteGadget.png! on the row of the gadget that you want to delete. It will display an alert message :
Click the OK button to accept deleting or Cancel button to quit without deleting.
